title: WTB: signed Old Judge cards specifically from 1888
author: uniship

posts.post_title: WTB: signed Old Judge cards specifically from 1888
posts.post_content:
Of course I say this tongue-in-cheek.  I’m of the camp where I’d bet 95 percent of these signed t206’s are forgeries. And the vast majority of ALL signed cards are fakes as well. 

In other words: caveat emptor times 100.
......  If you do find a signed N172 (real or not), I can tell you where to get it authenticated.....
How about posting a raw one and claiming that it was just pulled from a sealed pack? By your unnamed friend. Not on video.

Why clog up the BST board with a "tongue in cheek" thread when people really are looking to buy or sell cards in the BST section? There is a huge thread about the T206 forgeries on the main board in which to make "tongue in cheek" posts.

[quote name="Bored5000" post=1832099]Why clog up the BST board with a "tongue in cheek" thread when people really are looking to buy or sell cards in the BST section? There is a huge thread about the T206 forgeries on the main board in which to make "tongue in cheek" posts.[/QUOTE]

Eddie, 

That was my first reaction also, but you know what, I get it.... 

A little levity lightens it up.  This particular BST page is my favorite and not too busy so it doesn't disrupt the flow very much.  

You guys have a great weekend.
